ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:1.2_0: At that time the monks stored one of their robes with other monks and then left to wander in the country with a lower and an upper robe.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:1.3_0: Because they were stored for a long time, the robes became moldy.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:1.4_0: The monks put them out in the sun.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:1.5_0: While walking about the dwellings, Venerable Ānanda saw those monks doing this.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:1.8_0: And they told him what had happened.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:1.9_0: Venerable Ānanda complained and criticized them,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:1.10_0: “How can those monks store one of their robes with other monks and then leave to wander in the country with a lower and an upper robe?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:1.11_0: After rebuking those monks in many ways, Venerable Ānanda told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:1.12_0: “Is it true, monks, that monks do this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:1.15_0: “... How can these foolish men store one of their robes with other monks and then leave to wander in the country with a lower and an upper robe?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:1.16_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:1.17_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:1.18.1_0: ‘When his robe is finished and the robe-making season has ended, if a monk stays apart from his three robes even for a single day, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np2:1.19_0: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
